abstract: Prepare your app to respond to an incoming universal link.
overview:
## Overview

When a user activates a universal link, the system launches your app and sends it an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSUserActivity] object. Query this object to find out how your app launched and to decide what action to take.

To support universal links in your app:

### Update your app delegate to respond to a universal link

When the system opens your app as the result of a universal link, your app receives an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSUserActivity] object with an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSUserActivity/activityType] value of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSUserActivityTypeBrowsingWeb]. The activity object’s [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSUserActivity/webpageURL] property contains the HTTP or HTTPS URL that the user accesses. Use [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLComponents] APIs to extract the components of the URL. See the examples that follow.
